div1.head: Military Orders for Roger Post Ames and James Carroll, August 27, 1901
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, August 27, 1901.

1. Leave of absence for one (1) month, with permission
to apply for an extension of one (1) month and to go be-
yond the limits of the Department, is hereby granted to
1st Lieutenant E. B. Martindale, Artillery Corps.

2. Captain Roger P. Ames, Assistant Surgeon, U. S. Vol-
unteers, is hereby temporarily relieved as surgeon, Pirotec-
nia Militar and Santa Clara Battery, and will report to the
Chief Surgeon of the Department for duty in connection
with the investigation carried on by Contract Surgeon James
Carroll, U. S. Army, in accordance with paragraph 18,
Special Orders No. 172, current series, Headquarters of the
Army. Upon the conclusion of this investigation, Captain
Ames will resume his former duties.

Major Dámaso T. Lainé, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers, will
in addition to his present duties also perform those of Cap-
tain Ames at the Pirotecnia Militar and Santa Clara Battery.

3. In accordance with paragraph 18, Special Orders No.
172, current series, Headquarters of the Army, Contract
Surgeon James Carroll, U. S. Army, is authorized to carry
out the investigation therein prescribed at Las Animas
Hospital in this city, and the Director of said hospital will
afford him all necessary facilities for the purpose.

4. Under authority of the Acting Secretary of War,
dated August 17, 1901, General Prisoner Frank H. Barton,
late private company C, 10th Infantry, is hereby transferred
to Fort Columbus, New York Harbor, to serve out the
remainder of his sentence as published in paragraph 1,
Special Orders No. 46, series of 1900, Department of Ma-
tanzas and Santa Clara, and will be sent to that point by
the commanding officer, Columbia Barracks, under suitable
guard, there to be turned over to the commanding officer.

All papers pertaining to the prisoner will be transmitted
to the commanding officer, Fort Columbus, New York
Harbor.

Upon completion of this duty the guard will return to its
proper station.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

5. Paragraph 1, Special Orders No. 183, current series,
these Headquarters, relating to Captain Charles J. Stevens,
2d Cavalry, is hereby revoked.
